commonSymptoms: Downloaded Streaks, Habitica, Productive, Way of Life (used each for 3-7 days max)

rootCauses: Tracker provides no structure (blank checkboxes, no progressive plan)
Zero-reset punishment design triggers shame spiral and quitting
No measurement of identity transformation (just 'did you do it? yes/no')
Gamification without depth (fake coins/badges vs real personal growth)
No habit stacking guidance (tracking habits in isolation instead of synergistically)
Generic tracking (not personalized to YOUR baseline and goals)
scientificExplanation: Most habit trackers fail because they're designed for tracking, not behavior change. Research on habit formation (Lally et al. 2009) shows: 1) Habits require 66 days average for automaticity, 2) Progressive difficulty adaptation is critical, 3) Identity shift ('I'm someone who does X') predicts long-term success. Empty checkbox apps provide none of this. Zero-reset streaks create shame-based motivation (proven to fail long-term). You don't need better tracking—you need personalized behavior change system with progressive structure, forgiving progress model, and identity measurement.
failedSolutions: Streaks: Beautiful UI, but zero-reset = shame spiral after first miss
Habitica: RPG gamification feels childish, no real habit formation science
Way of Life: Good/bad binary doesn't measure progress spectrum
Productive: Generic templates don't account for YOUR baseline fitness/discipline
Loop Habit Tracker: Open source but lacks progressive plan generation
whyTheyFail: These apps are passive trackers, not active behavior change systems. They assume you already know how to build habits (most people don't). Zero-reset creates all-or-nothing pressure. Generic tracking ignores that YOUR Day 1 workout ≠ athlete's Day 1. Fake gamification (coins, levels) doesn't address real identity transformation. You need: personalized progressive plan + forgiving progress system + identity metrics + habit stacking strategy.

faqs.question: Why does NooLife's 2-task minimum system work better than streak counting?
faqs.answer: Streak counting creates all-or-nothing pressure (miss one day = total failure feeling). NooLife's 2-task minimum recognizes life happens—you can slip on one habit but maintain progress with others. This forgiving system prevents shame spirals that make people quit trackers entirely. Progress over perfection = long-term success.
